fields.description:
The new UI provides the functional match of the 4 dialogs in the snapshot landing page.

- create snapshot
- delete snapshot
- create volume from snapshot (re-use create volume, pre-populating snapshot)
- register as image
- manage tags (re-use tag editor)
fields.summary: Functional Match of 4 Dialogs on Snapshot Landing Page

comments.body: Pull request at https://github.com/eucalyptus/koala/pull/28

create snapshot:
- volume selector doesn't included names of volumes, so user cannot type in a name instead of an ID (regression)
- Description is NOT required, so we need to change that.

delete snapshot:
- doesn't indicate if snapshot is registered as an image (regression)
- delete on registered snapshot fails since it doesn't get deregistered first.  (regression)

create volume from snapshot:
- doesn't give option to name snapshot. (regression)
- Description is NOT requried

register as image:
- can't see a way to do this (regression)

manage tags:
- functionally achieved on detail page, though simpler tag editing heuristics, might confuse existing users.
I'm going to tackle these as well, since very similar to GUI-200

[~dkavanagh]: See the security group detail page on how to display the name/description as info text rather than disabled fields.  Note that the form class __init__ method sets the initial data to ensure the name/description fields don't fail validation (if they're required).
PR https://github.com/eucalyptus/koala/pull/37/files

* create snap: search for volume from selector does not work for name
* create volume submit button text does not match wireframe
* don't see any register snap as image option
* please be sure delete snap when registered as image shows correct text once that is implemented

I think the "search not working for name" might be a widget thing and we'll need to look at ways to fix that.

"register snap as image" is definitely not implemented... correct.

deleting snapshots registered or not works AFAIK. I did test with registered and non-registered snapshots.
PR is here: https://github.com/eucalyptus/koala/pull/49
Created https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/GUI-283 to address widget autocomplete issue.

* Button text for create volume from snap submit button still does not match wireframe
* Please move delete to last button. It shoudl always be ont he bottom. Thanks!
https://github.com/eucalyptus/koala/pull/50
PR was merged before the holidays, UX review done.
Things cannot go into QA without getting reviewed by me first.
for ux review.

* create snap needs breadcrumbs instead of back button
* create snap submit button text should be "Create Snapshot" not "Add Snapshot" (same for dialog when launched from volume side) (done)
* help should not display by default, should be collapsed
* cannot verify if create snap when no volumes are available is implemented. Please check and ensure that it is. (no way to create a snapshot without a volume)
https://github.com/eucalyptus/koala/pull/89

Almost there! Just a few things:

* You can create a snapshot using the create snapshot button on the snapshot landing page, even if there are no volumes. Can you be sure this displays the correct thing in this case, I can't verify, there are too many volumes)?
* help should be addressed separately I guess.

Question about snapshot creation here. In the old app, we had a dialog and changing contents was pretty trivial. In the new app, there is a whole other screen users go to for creation. If there are no volumes, should we simply disable the button, or pop up a warning and don't let them nav to create?  (saying "You must have volumes before you can create snapshots")?

We should definitely keep the menu option available and pop up a warning modal box. Can you do the dialog like it used to be? The text there said: "You must have volumes before you can create snapshots." with a link underneath to "Create new volume". You could even make the action button Create New Volume if you want, and they they can cancel out if they don't wanna.
https://github.com/eucalyptus/koala/pull/101
